title: Bug: Enemies spawning on top of each other
description: Enemies spawn at overlapping positions. Need spawn point spacing or overlap check before instantiation.
close_reason: Fixed spawn overlap: (1) Increased minSpawnSeparation default from 1.5 to 2.0 (2) Added recentSpawnPositions tracking to prevent rapid successive spawns at same location (3) Fallback spawn now applies horizontal offset instead of using raw spawn point position (4) WaveManager now calls ResetSpawnPoints between waves (5) PickSpawnPoint checks both alive enemy positions and recent spawn positions

title: Bug: Character creation appearance/sprites not showing as class selection
description: Character creation screen doesn't display class-specific sprites/appearance. Class selection visual feedback is broken.
close_reason: Fixed character creation class preview sprites not displaying. Root causes: (1) HasJobVisualData() checked array length but not individual entries, so GUID references resolving to null passed the check. Now validates at least one non-null sprite exists. (2) SetInitialPreview, TryApplyJobPreview, and UpdatePreviewAnimation only checked idlePreviewFrames[0] which could be null even with valid later entries. Now iterates all frames to find first non-null sprite. (3) FindJobData now more aggressively prefers assets with valid visual data over runtime duplicates from SkillManager fallback. (4) Added procedural silhouette fallback in SetInitialPreview when no valid sprite is found. (5) TryLoadClassSprites now applies HeroKnight fallback per-class instead of all-or-nothing.

close_reason: Fixed Player-Enemy collision pushing: (1) Updated Physics2D LayerCollisionMatrix to disable Player<->Enemy and Enemy<->Enemy physical collisions (2) Converted EnemyController contact damage from OnCollisionStay2D to OverlapCircle-based detection in FixedUpdate so contact damage still works without physical pushing

title: Bug: Stat increases don't affect displayed health/mana, damage and crit do nothing
description: Increasing stats doesn't update the actual health/mana displayed. Damage and crit stats have no effect. Speed stat increases work. Stats may not be properly applied to gameplay calculations.
close_reason: Fixed two root causes: (1) CombatController.statSystem was null because StatSystem is dynamically added by PlayerControllerScript.Awake(), but CombatController.Awake() ran before it existed and never retried. Added Start() retry and lazy-init in GetDamageMultiplier()/GetCritChance(). This fixes damage multiplier and crit chance stats having no effect. (2) Health/mana display bars used Time.deltaTime for smooth animation, but the stat menu pauses the game (timeScale=0), freezing all bar animations while allocating stats. Changed HealthDisplay, ManaDisplay, and PlayerStatBars to use Time.unscaledDeltaTime, matching ResourceBarDisplay which already worked correctly.

title: Bug: Enemies randomly teleport away then reappear
description: Enemies sporadically teleport to distant positions and then reappear. Likely Animator overriding physics position or state machine transition issue.
close_reason: Fixed enemy teleport bug: (1) Added animator.applyRootMotion = false in EnemyController.Awake() to prevent Animator from overriding physics position via animation curves (2) LateUpdate physics re-sync was already in place as a second line of defense

title: Bug: No SFX on enemy hit
description: Hitting enemies produces no sound effect. Check EnemyData.hurtSound assignment and SFXManager playback integration.
close_reason: Root cause: all EnemyData assets (SlimeData, BatData, TurretData) had null hurtSound fields. The code path was correct but silent-by-design for null clips. Fix: added fallback chain in EnemyController.HandleDamageTaken that tries EnemyData.hurtSound -> fallbackHurtSound (new SerializeField) -> AttackData.hitSound -> AttackData.attackSound. The lastReceivedAttackData is cached in TakeDamage() and consumed in HandleDamageTaken(). This ensures enemy hits produce the attacker weapon swing sound as a last resort until dedicated hurt sounds are assigned in the EnemyData assets.
